intro: Anthistiria membranacea, commonly known as the membranous anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, membranous leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
